info.orestes.rest.conversion

Class Converter<T,F>

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.orestes.rest.conversion.Converter<T,F>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The java type which can be handled by this converter
    F - The format that this Converter decode and encode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StringBooleanConverter, StringByteConverter, StringCharacterConverter, StringDoubleConverter, StringFloatConverter, StringIntegerConverter, StringLongConverter, StringRestExceptionConverter, StringShortConverter, StringStringConverter

    public abstract class Converter<T,F>
extends java.lang.Object
    A Converter converts a specific java type T between an format and the java object. Therefore a Converter is only responsible to handle the conversion form and to one specific format declared by the parameter F.

    To read and write the format form bytes a ConverterFormat for the format F must be registered to the ConverterService

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Converter()
      Creates a new Converter instance which can convert between the java type T and the format F

      • getFormatType

        public java.lang.Class<F> getFormatType()
        Returns the format type that this converter process. It is extracted form the actual class signature
        Returns:
        The format type F of this converter

        Returns the java type that this converter handle. It is extracted form the actual class signature
        Returns:

      • toFormat

        protected <E> F toFormat(Context context,
                         java.lang.Class<E> type,
                         java.lang.Object source)
                  throws RestException
        This helper method can be used by a Converter implementation to convert other java types to our format
        Type Parameters:
        E - The java type of the decoded value
        Parameters:
        context - The Context used by some Converters to perform the conversion
        type - The class of the decoded value
        source - The value to encode
        Returns:
        The encoded value
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if no converter is available to handle the conversion
        RestException - if an exception occurred while encoding the value

      • toFormat

        protected <E> F toFormat(Context context,
                         EntityType<E> genericType,
                         java.lang.Object source)
                  throws RestException
        This helper method can be used by a Converter implementation to convert other java types to our format
        Type Parameters:
        E - The java type of the decoded value
        Parameters:
        context - The Context used by some Converters to perform the conversion
        genericType - The java type with generic parameters of the decoded value
        source - The value to encode
        Returns:
        The encoded value
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if no converter is available to handle the conversion
        RestException - if an exception occurred while encoding the value

      • toFormat

        public abstract F toFormat(Context context,
                           T source,
                           java.lang.Class<?>[] genericParams)
                    throws RestException
        Encodes the given value to the format
        Parameters:
        context - The Context that can be used to access Request arguments
        source - The value being encoded
        genericParams - The actual generic parameter types that will be used to encoded the generic value
        Returns:
        the encoded value
        Throws:
        RestException - if an expected conversion error occurred
